It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters at the ends of the branches, creating a visually appealing display. Cuphea schwackei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
